citation.article-title: Peptostreptococcus russellii sp. nov., isolated from a swine-manure storage pit
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Peptostreptococcus russellii sp. nov.

Peptostreptococcus russellii (rus.sel′li.i N.L. gen. masc. n. russellii of Russell, named after the late American microbiologist James B. Russell for his contributions to rumen microbiology and initial isolation of HAP bacteria).
The description is based on seven strains, isolated from swine faeces and stored manure.
Cells are obligatory anaerobic, Gram-reaction-positive, non-motile cocci, ~0.8−1.0 µm, occurring in pairs and chains of 3–10 cells.
After 48 h of growth on BHI agar under anaerobic conditions, colonies are convex, 2–3 mm in diameter, opaque, smooth and whitish in colour.
Grows in liquid culture at 25–45 °C (optimum 37 °C) but not at 4 or 50 °C.
No growth occurs after 24 h in static or shaking aerobic BHI broth or on aerobic BHI agar plates.
Weakly saccharolytic.

Using the API rapid ID32An system: positive for proline arylamidase and negative for N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, alanine arylamidase, alkaline phosphorylase, arginine dihydrolase, α-arabinosidase, arginine arylamidase, α-fucosidase, α- and β-galactosidase, β-galactosidase-6-phosphate, α- and β-glucosidase, β-glucuronidase, glutamyl glutamic acid arylamidase, glycine arylamidase, histidine arylamidase, leucyl glycine arylamidase, mannose, phenylalanine arylamidase, pyroglutamic acid arylamidase, raffinose, serine arylamidase, tyrosine arylamidase and urease.
Using the API ZYM identification system, no positive reactions are obtained.
The major end-product from glucose metabolism is acetate, with smaller amounts of lactate, formate and citrate and trace amounts of succinate detected.
Prodigious amounts of ammonia (>40 mM) are produced from various nitrogen sources (Tryptone and Casamino acids).
Nitrate is not reduced and catalase, coagulase and indole are not produced.
The cell-wall peptidoglycan is type A4α l-Lys–d-Asp.
Whole-cell-wall sugars consist of glucose, xylose and traces of mannose.
The major long-chain fatty acid is iso-C16 : 0.
No respiratory quinones are detected.
The polar lipid profile comprises aminoglycolipid, diphosphatidylglycerol, glycolipids, phosphatidylglycerol and phospholipids.
The type strain, RT-10BT ( = CCUG 58235T = NRRL B-59380T = DSM 23041T), was isolated from a swine manure storage pit (habitat not known).
The G+C content of the DNA of the type strain is 35.6 mol%.
